RepresentativeComplaints.Description: IN 2006, WE OBSERVED A LINE CRACK IN THE DASH. TOOK THE TRUCK TO A DODGE DEALERSHIP AND WAS TOLD IT WILL COST OVER $1000 TO REPLACE DASH. TOO EXPENSIVE, BOUGHT A DASH COVER TO COVER IT UP. MORE CRACKS DEVELOPED OVER THE YEARS, AND THE DASH IS NOW BROKEN.

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2001 DODGE RAM 1500.  THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE INSTRUMENT PANEL WAS CRACKING AND FALLING APART.  THE DEALER AND MANUFACTURER STATED THAT THERE WAS NO OPEN CAMPAIGN ON THIS DEFECT.  ONE OF THE PLASTIC PIECES FROM THE INSTRUMENT PAN

2001 DODGE RAM 1500, THE DASH IS LITERALLY CRUMBLING DAILY. I HAVE 1 VERY LARGE HOLE & LARGE CRACKS ALL OVER. THE DASH HAD GOTTEN WORSE EVERY WEEK. I HAVE DONE NOTHING TO REPAIR THIS AS IT IS NOT REPAIRABLE UNLESS THE COMPLETE DASH IS REPLACED. THE HOLE I

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2001 DODGE RAM 1500. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE DASH BOARD WAS DETACHING FROM THE VEHICLE IN LARGE PIECES. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE VIN WAS NOT AVAILABLE. THE APPROXIMATE FAI

DURING THE PAST 12 MONTHS, MY DASHBOARD DEVELOPED A HAIRLINE CRACK AND NOW LOOKS LIKE A ZIGGEDY ZAGGEDY PUZZLE WITH SOME EDGES VERY SHARP.  THE DASH IS POPPED UP NOW AND DOESN'T EVEN STAY PERFECTLY FLAT.  I AM FEELING A RECALL SHOULD BE ISSUED OR SOME TYP

THE DASHBOARD CRACKED AND NOW HAS A HOLE IN IT.  I CONTACTED MY LOCAL DODGE DEALER AND THEY WOULD NOT OFFER ANY ASSISTANCE WITH THE REPLACEMENT OF THE DASH.  THE DASH CRACKING AND FAILURE COULD LEAD TO ELECTRICAL ISSUES AS SEEN WITH OTHER DODGE RAM 1500'S

MY DASH HAS BEEN CRACKING OUT OVER THE LAST YEAR . THE CRACKS LOOK IDENTICAL TO PICTURES OF OTHER DODGE TRUCK DASHES I'VE SEEN ON THE INTERNET AND NEWS. I AND SO MANY OTHER OWNERS ARE EXPERIENCING CRACKS THAT A SAFETY RECALL SHOULD BE ISSUED IMMEDIATELY B

IN JUNE OF 2006 I NOTICED A HAIRLINE CRACK IN THE DASH OF MY 2001 DODGE RAM 1500, WHICH ONLY HAD 36,000 ON IT AT THE TIME.  I DID NOT HAVE IT REPAIRED THINKING THE DEALER WOULD JUST TELL ME IT WAS USUAL WEAR AND TEAR.  SINCE THAT DAY THE DASH HAS CONTINUE

TRANSMISSION FAILURE DUE TO TORQUE CONVERTOR FAILURE. WENT TO DEALERSHIP WHILE UNDER WARRANTY WAS TOLD EVERYTHING WAS FINE AT 34000 MILES. AT 43000 MILES TRANSMISSION WENT OUT. NOW I AM OUT THE MONEY TO FIX IT WHEN IF THEY HAD FIXED THE PROBLEM AT 34000 M

I TOOK MY TRUCK TO A DEALERSHIP TO HAVE THE TRANSMISSION LOOKED OUT BEFORE THE WARRANTY OF 36,000 WENT OUT AND THEY STATED THERE WAS NOTHING WRONG WITH IT.THEN WHEN THE TRANSMISSION HAD 50,200 MILES THE TRANSMISSION BURNED UP ..I HAD TO PAY 3200.00 .I CAL

I OWN A DODGE RAM 1500 SPORT 4X4 WHICH HAS 6700 MILES ON IT.  AT 3800 MILES THE TRANSMISSION WENT OUT.  MARK THOMAS MOTORS IN ALBANY SAID THEY WILL REPLACE THE TRANSMISSION BECAUSE THERE ISN'T A REASON FOR IT TO HAVE GONE OUT, AT NO COST TO ME.  AT 67K MI

I OWN A DODGE RAM 1500 SPORT 4X4 WHICH HAS 6700 MILES ON IT.  AT 3800 MILES THE TRANSMISSION WENT OUT.  MARK THOMAS MOTORS IN ALBANY SAID THEY WILL REPLACE THE TRANSMISSION BECAUSE THERE ISN'T A REASON FOR IT TO HAVE GONE OUT, AT NO COST TO ME.  AT 67K MI

I OWN A 2001 DODGE RAM TRUCK. I BOUGHT THE TRUCK USED FROM A DEALERSHIP WITH 40,000 MILES ON IT. ONE WEEK LATER THE TRANSMISSION BLEW. I HAD TO PAY $1500 TO GET IT FIXED. THIS HAS BEEN AN ONGOING PROBLEM WITH THE TRUCK SINCE I BOUGHT IT. NO BODY CAN FIGUR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2001 DODGE RAM 1500.  THE CONTACT DROVE THE VEHICLE TO A LOCAL REPAIR SHOP FOR A ROUTINE TIRE ROTATION.  THE MECHANIC INFORMED HER THAT THE FRONT DRIVER'S AND PASSENGER SIDE TIRES WERE CUT.  THE TIRES WERE ROTATED AND SHE CONTINUED D

5/19/05 I HAD TO REPLACE ALL (4) TIRES DUE TO A DEFECT IN THE TIRE.  THE TIRES WERE COMING APART AROUND THE CROWN ON EVERY TIRE.  I WAS TOLD THAT THEY COULD BLOW AT ANYTIME AND IT WAS BEST THAT I REPLACE THEM ALL.  I BOUGHT THE TRUCK THEY WERE ON USED (20

FRONT TIRES ARE BEING CUT BY SHOCK BRACKET.  THERE IS NO STOP TO KEEP TIRES FROM RUBBING AGAINST SHOCK BRACKETS WHILE MAKING SHARP TURNS.  THIS IS A SAFETY DEFECT.  TRUCK IS EQUIPPED WITH FACTORY RIMS AND TIRES THAT ARE OF SPECIFIED SIZE BY MANUFACTURER.

DT*:  THE CONTACT STATED WHILE DRIVING 65 MPH THE RIGHT REAR TIRE DETACHED FROM THE VEHICLE.  AFTERWARDS THE VEHICLE FELL TO THE GROUND AND WAS PULLED TO THE SIDE OF THE ROAD.  AFTER THE TIRE WAS LOCATED THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO A LOCAL INDEPENDENT REPAIR

DT*:  THE CONTACT STATED WHILE DRIVING 65 MPH THE RIGHT REAR TIRE DETACHED FROM THE VEHICLE.  AFTERWARDS THE VEHICLE FELL TO THE GROUND AND WAS PULLED TO THE SIDE OF THE ROAD.  AFTER THE TIRE WAS LOCATED THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO A LOCAL INDEPENDENT REPAIR

DT*:  THE CONTACT STATED WHILE DRIVING 65 MPH THE RIGHT REAR TIRE DETACHED FROM THE VEHICLE.  AFTERWARDS THE VEHICLE FELL TO THE GROUND AND WAS PULLED TO THE SIDE OF THE ROAD.  AFTER THE TIRE WAS LOCATED THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO A LOCAL INDEPENDENT REPAIR

VEHICLE STARTED EXHIBITING STEERING PROBLEM AT 3000 MILES.  THE ORIGINAL DEALERSHIP DID A REALIGNMENT OF THE FRONT END, INSTALLED NEW SHOCKS, WE REPLACED THE TIRES EVEN THOUGH THE ORIGINAL TIRES WERE NOT WORN OUT, AND THE PROBLEM CONTINUED TO GET WORSE.

WHEN TURNING THE VEHICLE SHARPLY, THE CLEARANCE WAS OBSTRUCTING THE TIRE, CAUSING THE TIRE RUBBER TO DISINTEGRATE.  THE CONSUMER TOOK THE VEHICLE TO THE DEALER.  HOWEVER, THE DEALER WAS UNABLE TO DUPLICATE OR RESOLVE THE PROBLEM.   *AK   THE TIRES RUBBED
WHEN DRIVING  AT NIGHT HEADLIGHTS SHUT OFF, CAUSING THE DRIVER TO PULL OFF THE ROAD.  CONSUMER  NOTIFIED THE DEALER ABOUT THIS ISSUE, HOWEVER, MECHANIC CANT NOT DUPLICATE THE PROBLEM.  *AK

I OWN A 2001 DODGE RAM PICKUP AND THE DASH IS CRACKING IN SEVERAL PLACES. SPOKE TO THE DEALERSHIP AND WAS TOLD NOT COVERED UNDER WARRANTY. THESE ARE SEVERAL LARGE CRACKS ONE COMES FROM DEFROST VENT TOWARDS DRIVER AND HAS STARTED TO CURVE DOWN TOWARD INSTR

DASHBOARD AND CAP IS CRACKING UP INTO JAGGED PIECES. SHOULD THE AIR BAGS DEPLOY, SEVERE INJURY COULD RESULT FROM BEING PUNCTURED FROM PLASTIC SHRAPNEL MUCH MORE THAN  THE CAUSE OF THE AIRBAG DEPLOYMENT. I FEEL THE MANUFACTURER SHOULD IMPLEMENT A REPLACEME

DASHBOARD AND CAP IS CRACKING UP INTO JAGGED PIECES. SHOULD THE AIR BAGS DEPLOY, SEVERE INJURY COULD RESULT FROM BEING PUNCTURED FROM PLASTIC SHRAPNEL MUCH MORE THAN  THE CAUSE OF THE AIRBAG DEPLOYMENT. I FEEL THE MANUFACTURER SHOULD IMPLEMENT A REPLACEME

BOTH FRONTAL AIR BAGS DID NOT DEPLOY  AFTER A FRONTAL COLLISION WITH A GUARD RAIL AND A PHONE POLE AT 35 MPH. MANUFACTURER WAS NOT NOTIFIED AT THIS TIME. FEEL FREE TO PROVIDE ANY FURTHER INFORMATION.*AK

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2001 DODGE RAM 1500. THE CONTACT STATED  THAT THE DASHBOARD WAS CRACKED UNDERNEATH THE WINDSHIELD,  EXTENDED TO THE FRONT OF THE DASHBOARD; AROUND THE INDICATOR GAUGES AND TO THE FLOORBOARD. THE MANUFACTURER STATED THAT THE DASHBOAR
THE CONSUMER WAS IN A COLLISION AND THE AIR BAGS DID NOT DEPLOY. DEALER WAS CONTACTED AND STATED THAT IMPACT WAS NOT STRONG ENOUGH TO ACTIVATE THE SENSOR FOR THE AIR BAGS.

HOOD SAFETY LATCH ISSUE. POPPED LATCH FROM INSIDE OF TRUCK.  RECEIVED PHONE CALL, DID NOT OPEN HOOD.  FORGOT HOOD WAS POPPED, STARTED DRIVING.  HOOD FLEW OPEN BACK ONTO THE WINDSHIELD WARPING THE HOOD AND HINGES.*AK

DT*: THE CONTACT STATED WHILE TRAVELING 40 MPH, THE FRONT HOOD OPENED ON ITS OWN CAUSING DAMAGE TO THE VEHICLE.  THE SERVICE DEALER DETERMINED THIS OCCURRED DUE TO THE HOOD'S SAFETY LATCH BEING RUSTED.  THE HOOD, HINGES AND LOCKS ALL NEEDED TO BE REPLACED

DT*: THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE VEHICLE'S STEERING WAS VERY LOOSE AND THERE WAS DIFFICULTY IN KEEPING THE VEHICLE STRAIGHT.  THERE WAS A DISTINCT PULL TO THE RIGHT.  AFTER THE VEHICLE WAS TAKEN TO THE REPAIR SHOP FOR REALIGNMENT, THE VEHICLE BEGAN PULLIN

THE CONSUMER NOTICED THAT THE LEFT SIDE SUPPORT CABLE WAS BROKEN ON HIS TRUCK WHILE PARKED. THE DEALER INFORMED THE CONSUMER THAT THE TRUCK WAS NOT COVERED UNDER A RECALL.  *JB  TAIL GATE SUPPORT STRAP BROKEN (RIGHT SIDE).  TAIL GATE SUPPORT STRAP ALMOST

ABS SYSTEM ON THIS VEHICLE WILL NOT STOP IN PANIC SITUATIONS... EXCUSES INCLUDE CONSUMER EDUCATION, AND VEHICLE DESIGN... BRAKE PEDAL GOES HARD IN PANIC STOP, AND WILL NOT ALLOW VEHICLE TO BE STOPPED.. HAD TO USE THE EMERGENCY BRAKE... DEALER NO HELP... A

DT: DODGE RAM 2001 318.  WHILE DRIVING  NOTICED VAPOR COMING OUT OF TAIL PIPE.  CHECKED ALL FLUIDS AND COULD NOT FIND ANYTHING WRONG.  TOOK VEHICLE TO  MECHANIC, RAN A PRESSURE TEST, AND FOUND A LEAK,. HE SENT BOTH HEADS TO MACHINE AND BOTH HEADS WERE CRA

CONSUMER APPLIED BRAKES AT 35 MPH, PEDAL WENT TO THE FLOOR.  DEALER REPLACED ABS SENSOR.  ON 26 AUGUST 2002 AT 40-45 MPH  ABS LIGHT CAME ON, BRAKE WAS APPLIED, AND PEDAL AGAIN WENT TO THE FLOOR.  VEHICLE IS AT DEALERSHIP AT THIS TIME. PLEASE PROVIDE ADDIT

WHEN BRAKING TO SLOW DOWN OR STOP THERE WAS A LOUD NOISE COMING FROM THE BRAKES. TOOK  VEHICLE TO DEALERSHIP, AND MECHANIC INFORMED THE CONSUMER THAT  FRONT BRAKES WERE WARPED. THE PROBLEM COULD NOT BE SOLVED BY THE MECHANIC.*AK

WHEN THE BRAKES WERE APPLIED THEY LOCKED UP AND CAUSED EXTENDED STOPPING DISTANCE.  THE VEHICLE HAS BEEN TAKEN TO THE DEALER SEVERAL TIMES BUT THEY INDICATED THAT THE REAR ABS SYSTEM FUNCTIONED AS DESIGNED.  *AK  *CB  *NLM

HAD TO REPLACE CYLINDER HEADS AT 68000 MILES, NOT DUE TO WEAR AND TEAR ACCORDING TO REPAIR SHOP.  10 OUT OF THE LAST 12 DODGE TRUCKS INTO THE SHOP HAVE HAD TO HAVE THE SAME THING DONE.  I WAS TOLD TO KEEP MY PEPERWORK, BECAUSE THERE IS AN OBVIOUS PROBLEM

THE FRONT WHEEL ASSEMBLY, CONTROL ARMS, AND WHEEL HUBS HAD TO BE REPLACED BY LOCAL DEALER.  I WAS TOLD BY A TRAINED TECHNICIAN THAT THE WHEEL'S COULD HAVE BROKEN AWAY FROM THE VEHICLE WHILE DRIVING. THE ENGINE HEATER CORE AND AIR CONDITIONING MAIN ELEMENT

DURING ROUTINE INSPECTION THE DEALERSHIP INFORMED THE CONSUMER THAT RIGHT LOWER CONTROL ARM CRACKED.   *AK   THE CRACK WAS NOT CAUSED BY OVERLOADING OR HITTING AN OBJECT.  THE CRACKS DEVELOPED AT THE LOWER CONTROL ARM WELDS.  (FACTORY DEFECT)   *SC  *JB

BOTH FRONT HUB BEARINGS WERE COMPLETELY SHOT ON MY 2001 DODGE RAM 1500. THE TRUCK HAS ONLY 51,000 WITH NO OFF ROAD USE.  THERE SHOULD BE NO REASON TO REPLACE SEALED HUB BEARING AFTER ONLY 51,000 MILES. CONTINUED USE COULD HAVE RESULTED IN THE FRONT WHEELS

OIL GAUGE MALFUNCTIONED,  AND WENT DEAD, NOT DETECTING LOW  OIL PRESSURE.  DEALER FOUND SLUDGE IN  ENGINE THAT WOULD BUILD UP FROM OVERDUE OIL CHANGES. CONSUMER STATED OIL CHANGES WERE DONE ON   REGULAR BASIS,  BUT NOT A T THE DEALERSHIP. PLEASE PROVIDE M

VEHICLE JUST DIED NO WARNING NO CHECK ENGINE LIGHTS OIL PRESSURE GAUGE NORMAL, AND NOW I HAVE A BLOWN ENGINE.  I WAS TOLD THERE WAS SOME SLUDGE IN THE ENGINE DUE TO LACK OF REGULAR OIL CHANGES.  THE OIL WAS CHANGED EVERY THREE TO FIVE THOUSND MILES.  STIL

MY DASH HAS BEEN CRACKING OUT OVER THE LAST FEW YEARS. FOR ABOUT THE LAST 10 MONTHS TO A YEAR I HAVE HAD CHECK ENGINE LIGHT THAT HAS NO SIGNIFICANCE TO THE WAY IT RUNS, AND THE CODE IS UNRECOGNIZABLE TO AUTO GARAGE. ALSO I HAVE WIRING PROBLEMS FOR ABOUT T

DT*:  THE CONTACT STATED WHILE DRIVING 50 MPH AFTER THE GEARS CHANGED THE TRANSMISSION FAILED IN THE VEHICLE.  THERE WAS NO WARNING OR WARNING LIGHTS TO ALERT THE CONTACT OF THIS FAILURE.  THE VEHICLE WAS TOWED TO A DEALERSHIP, UPON INSPECTION THE PROBLEM

ENGINE IDLE IS ERRATIC, BOTH IN NEUTRAL AND IN GEAR.  WILL SPEED UP WHILE DRIVING, OR WHILE AT A STOP LIGHT, OR WHILE IN PARK.  HAS CAUSED VEHICLE TO LURCH FORWARD.  DEALER CANNOT FIND PROBLEM.  IT IS MORE SEVERE WHEN COLD.  *NLM
